column4: i have problems with multi booting; i've installed xp aside ubuntu, before ubuntu worked fine - no problems. Now after installing xp: the xp bootloader does not provide to start the ubuntu any more
the partition is intact, but i cannot acces and not startup ubuntu any more: does any one can help me
i have a boot cd of ubuntu
what you mean: alot?
try that cd and open a terminal and then do grub-install /dev/hda
did you try what I said above?
you can just go to applications>accessorises right?
good luck

i've just explored the disk; the only files with grub.. i can find are on \pool\main\g\grub and \pool\main\g\grub-installer . The disk contains an iso image. I've got it from a magazine, without additional comment.
the directories contain DEB-files
I guess those will do.  Have you the plain ubuntu CD?
or the "install" CD?
i do not now how i could run a DEB file. the only thing i can do is to run the cd as boot-cd
well the  grub-install was not a DEB file
right?
it that's the case then do "\pool\main\g\grub-installer /dev/hda"
OH!
so it was \pool\main\g\grub-installer.deb not plain grub-install?
well. that sucks...oh...try and see if you can mount your partition (ubuntu install)
once you do that then do <mount point> /sbin/grub-install /dev/hda
it needs other stuff to.. I have no idea what but I'm pretty sure it does need other stuff.
